Author: 3 November 2021
Review: Suriya's Jai Bhim Deserves To Get An Oscar Award For The Best Movie, And Suriya Deserves To Get The Best Actor Award !!!
Review_Url: In a scene in Jai Bhim, a group of tribals man meet a police office who is heading an inquiry commission about the disappearance of three missing tribals who were being interrogated by the police about a theft case. One man tells him that he was once arrested by cops just for greeting them. Another tells him about how he was arrested just because he tried to slink away fearing them. A woman narrates how her husband was forced to 'confess' to a crime which he had not committed after the cops started molesting her. A young boy mentions that the police picked him up just because they could not get his father, and how that one incident made him a perennial suspect at school. These people are clearly damned if they did, and damned if they didn't.

Author: 9 November 2021
Review: "It will be quite an uphill battle."
Review_Url: There's some serious upvoting for this film here on IMDb; if not for a weighted averaging of the film's rating by viewers, this would be the number one movie of all time having just come out this year, and that by a wide margin. I thought the movie was good for it's portrayal of corrupt authorities taken down by a dedicated attorney, it hit on many of the points that social justice advocates clamor for here in this country. Based on a true story, one can only marvel at the dedication of a man like Chandru (Suriya), who utilized every bit of means and cunning to humiliate the brutal police authorities and their corrupt political allies. Many times it's a difficult story to watch, as the beatings and punishment doled out by district police against members of lower castes approach grotesquely inhumane treatment. Chandru's efforts eventually pay off, and it was inspiring to see him honored by the citizens he represented at the finale, reminiscent of that final scene of Gregory Peck in "To Kill A Mockingbird".

Review: A riveting and raw legal drama with mind-blowing performances from Suriya and Lijumol
Review_Url: Director Gnanavel captures the raw nature of police brutality with a high degree of realism, and every scene was emotionally charged. Suriya brings another firebrand performance after SP, and delivers with his impeccable dialogue delivery and mannerism. I'm glad they didn't add any unnecessary mass/commercial scenes just because it is a Suriya film, and even the songs went along with the story instead destroying the pace. Another important mention is Lijomol Jose's performance as the Irular women who nailed it in every scene.

Author: 8 November 2021
Review_Url: JAI BHIM (Hindi Movie, Amazon Prime,2021) - Bravo!!! If you have to see only one movie in 2021, watch this one. It's unsettling, shocking, real. In the era of SQUID GAME and Suryavanshi fantasies, we need such real life stories. I feel so much guilty that we are still carrying the burden of this 2500 years old rotten caste system where our fellow human beings are still treated worse than animals. As if the actors have not acted, it feels like I am watching CCTV footage! There is minimal heroism, maximum expression. There is not much court room drama, still the pace of the story is intense. The police and system which were supposed to protect us, provide everybody equal rights for survival, in reality literally killing people based on their surnames!!! :-( This movie based on a real life story on tribal rights made me sad, this movie made me hopeful too! Hats Off to all the Actor-Director-Story Writers and entire crew members. 10/10.

Author: 2 November 2021
Review: Suriya & Co. deliver a hard-hitting social issue drama! [+73%]
Review_Url: It's always nice to see a star like Suriya move away from a typical masala flick for Diwali and come up with a hard-hitting courtroom drama based on actual events. In the film, he is more of a tool that helps enact justice for the oppressed victims. There's no showy entry, songs that praise him to the skies, or stock heroines who exist only to admire him. Instead, the film focuses more on the tribal characters played by Manikandan and Lijomol (both excellent) and the series of unfortunate events that they go through.

Author: 17 November 2021
Review: Casteism does exist in 21st century India...
Review_Url:
There are 36 tribes in TamilNadu. Most from these tribes depend on agriculture, forests and cultivation for their livelihood. This is a story of 4 who belong to one such tribe who work for upper caste in rat infestation control and catching snakes in their homes. The oppressor and the oppressed... a habeas corpus case... court drama ... movie does succeed in portraying a heinous gruesome picture of the atrocities and systematic violence that are being committed by the police, the upper caste, the justice system and the government against these tribes. A bitter reality... in last 5 years In the last five years, a total of 300 caste-related murders have been reported in Tamil Nadu and most victims were Dalits. At least two Dalits are assaulted every hour in 21st-century India, and every day, three Dalit women are raped, two Dalits are murdered and two Dalit homes are torched on average. Over 200 million Dalits, who comprise nearly 17% of India's population, face the threat of such violence daily (Ref: Wire)
The apotheosis of the protagonist and few unnecessary jail sequences however takes away the focus from the underlying tribal issue .. but it does not fail to deliver a strong message and demands one to introspect.. thought provoking, based on true story .. Surya brings the perception in story telling to an 'unfortunately a truism' .. a great watch ..

Author: 19 November 2021
Review: A true story that I wish wasn't
Review_Url: Jai Bhim, inspired from the real life incident of the Indian state of Tamil Nadu. This movie is not about just one family or community but millions of people that face oppression from the hands of legislature, executives and judiciary even after more than 75 years of independence. Very well written and directed. Perfect casting for every role, hats off for the casting director for casting such amazing indigenous actors for each role. I don't even want to talk about acting performances because I don't think I'm quite qualified to talk about it. Suriya sir did it again after Soorarai Pottru and supporting cast deserves a special mention, TBH, they performed better than most bollywood actors. Indian cinema deserves more movies like this. Thank you Prime Video for producing such high quality movies.

Author: 4 November 2021
Review: Suriya scores a brace with Jai Bhim
Review_Url: Having previously given arguably one of the greatest Tamil movie hits on OTT platform with Soorarai Potru,Suriya has scored a brace with JaiBhim. I must say these real life inspired movies are really helping his cause providing fodder for his immense acting talent. Although communal oppression and custodial violence has been portrayed in several films before, it is the raw treatment which sets this film apart. The guy who acted as Samikannu literally must be awarded an Oscar for all the abuse he took onscreen. His spouse just lived the role with her great natural acting. All the supporting actors played their part to their perfection. All in all , jai bhim is the perfect watch if u are not into so called mass superstars and mad fandom.

Author: 3 November 2021
Review_Url: Intense and hard-hitting movie . This movie is based on a real incident that took place on 1995 . Really can't imagine how tribal people were treated by the police and society . Most of the scenes were disturbing , especially Police brutality towards tribes . After Visaranai this movie majorly spoke about Police brutality . I think director done good background work on this case . Movie was not only disturbing , also interesting too , investigation sequence were very well handled . Dialogue writing was also great support to the movie hard-hitting and thought provoking dialogues . Sengani character was the highlight of the movie , Lijo Jose very well performed in that role . Suriya's performance and dialogue delivery were awesome , Prakash Raj very well supported . Manikandan had less screentime but gave a very good performance . Every cast done their job . Technical team work was good , especially makeup artists and art work . Cinematography was good . Sean Roldan music was mind blowing . Only negative I felt bit lag in few places . Atlast a emotional , intense and hard-hitting movie , a very important movie that should be watched . A must watch and highly recommend .

Author: 26 November 2021
Review: Jai Bhim- Heart in the right place but...
Review_Url: Looks like those who have watched Jai Bheem are already divided in two groups. The ones belonging to the segment which has superliked this innocuously immature movie and are championing it to be a messiah of their lost ideology and those who are considering this as a threat to their existence. It has a rating of 9.6 on IMDB and yet to come in the top 250 list of the database provided by the site even after securing nearly 56k votes when this review is being written, a proof of the fact that something is wrong with the metrics and the effervescent rating will overcome the emotional doldrums and will stabilize soon after the initial emotions doze off. This shows how people belonging to any particular political ideology have strongly voted in favor of this movie. On the other hand, the way this movie is being slammed by some so called 'Film Pundits' or the 'Protectors of the nation' on several social media platforms show their unnecessary fear of losing their propaganda politics for a mere movie. The real metrics of IMDB will come into action when the initial zeal will die off from both the parties. Wait till that day to be too biased by any judgmental review.

Author: 10 December 2021
Review_Url: I really like Suriya and his acting, from Ghajini to recent Soorarai Pottru i enjoyed his movie. But this movie was made with unwanted controversies. Movie is based on real incident... fine, then show as it happened why you change the religion? The movie tried to portray discrimination experienced by the unprivileged class of society... It's a good thought. But in the real incident (based which this movie was made) the sub inspector was a Christian but in the movie his character was modified into an upper caste man. Why Anthony Das becomes Guru here? All other main character names are retained. The original characters have been intentionally replaced to target specific communities who are against the Surya's favorite Ruling party. Only because their minority appeasement will come to stake or there will be a question mark on their so called secularism ideology. The moment I saw Periyar (person who was believed to fight against discrimination, but filled with hatred towards hindu traditions) I was disgusted. This movie is made to create hate towards certain communities which was unnecessary.

Author: 26 November 2021
Review_Url: In a country where justice is a luxury, and can easily be bought if you're in the right position or quite well off. How would a pregnant woman from a very lower-cast, with no money would fight a case against the system and the corruption deep rooted within those who are the face of this so called system... win her battle to find what really happened to her husband and love? An angel in the form of a true lawyer will be by her side, but it's not going to be an easy one--so tighten your belts and get on this roller-coaster of emotions with a box of tissue-paper by your side. I'm actually numb with my eyes welled up with tears as I type this.

Author: 29 December 2021
Review: A gut wrenching and heartbreaking film that is a must watch for everyone.
Review_Url: This is not an entertainment film. Jai Bhim is more of an educational film that needs to be seen by everyone. Jai Bhim shows us a reality that we conveniently ignore and overlook, because it's too ugly and depressing, and we just want beauty and positivity in our life. We are fed with movies like Sooryavanshi, where policemen have superhuman abilities and are always acting in the best interests of the people, but the true picture is very different from the one shown to us by the likes of Rohit Shetty. We as human beings do not believe in the concept of "always punch up", we derive pleasure out of exploiting the poor, weak and the downtrodden. We have turned ourselves into the monsters that we used to read about in the fairytales as kids. 'Jai Bhim' shows us the mirror that we just don't have the courage to look into.

Author: 3 November 2021
Review: Possibly the best movie that came out in 2021
Review_Url: A very good film that highlights a very big problem that still exists today. Police (and the government) brutality VS native tribal people who are powerless. I have to say that every character in this film gave a very good performance. It's 165 mins long but there is no waste scenes and I was watching this with full focus.

Author: 18 June 2022
Review_Url: The strength of this film lies in its evocative performances and direct portrayal of its subject matter. When covering the issue of caste discrimination, it does not shy away from all the horrific ways the authorities inflict injustice on the tribal group. Throughout the film, they exist to the police only as useful scapegoats to inflate their arrest records as they don't have the wealth or social status to defend themselves. This is all portrayed in a tense and brutal way as the actors always show they are in constant anguish and it never shies away from direct violence (which got too much at times). It strikes a fine balance between cynicism and hope, as embodied by the main lawyer character who is a reluctant hero and is pessimistic about the missing men but is defiant enough to try to find them anyway. My main concern with the film was the odd editing as time skips around a lot in very confusing ways, especially when there are so many characters.

Review: The film depicts the story of justice in an environment where the executors of justice are corrupt.
Review_Url: The story of the film is an excellent crime story that the pieces of the story are well put together and the viewer enjoys following this criminal puzzle. What has contributed to the film's appeal and excitement is the very heated and challenging court battles that nail the viewer to the foot of the film. In general, the film has a very deep story and looks at the issue of justice from a good angle and impresses the viewer and well explains the corruption of justice administrators in third world countries, And it shows that there is a very long way to go to establish justice in these countries.

Author: 26 November 2021
Review_Url: This's one of the best movies in the History of Indian cinema. It is based on a true incident of Tamilnadu, where Rajakannu's custodial death challenged the judicial system and raised questions on Police department. It's an intense crime drama which is also very realistic and relevant. Director Gnajavel did a remarkable job. Suriya, Manikandan, Prakash Raj, Rajisha Vijayan and other actors delivered their best and made this movie a huge success. Lijomol Jose deserves national award for her acting. Cinematography was exquisite. Songs and background scores are intense. It keeps you engaged throughout the movie. Overall, it's a great movie.

Author: 2 January 2022
Review: Review and reflect, be able to face history, good!
Review_Url:
This is a powerful film that hits the inequality of class society in India in the 1990 s and exposes the inferiority of its class superiority and black gold politics. Perumalsami: "It is true that in order to uphold democracy, someone from some era has to become a dictator."
In such movies, there are always many scenes and shots that make people angry and shudder. Those in power ignore life as a matter of course. It is like a routine abuse of violence. The direct lens is even more intuitive than the horror film. But even if there are thousands of ugly things in this world, as long as there is a voice that is unwilling to be silent, the world will not be so bad.

At least we are now more aware on the Police atrocity & societies attitude towards tribal people. Hats off to the Real Chandu the lawyer.

Author: 18 December 2021

Movie was good and i was wishing top heros plays the low caste roles than character artists. Police people f. C. U. K. Ur attitude.

Author: 25 November 2021
Review: A real life incident based movie is Jai Bhim. In this movie, projected a real life hero as Villian. So this movie trying to make castes based violences in Tamil Nadu.
Review_Url: Rajakkannu, a tribal from Kammapuram near Virudhachalam in Cuddalore district, was taken to the police station in 1993 on a charge of theft and was later found dead after being severely tortured by the police during interrogation.

Author: 8 January 2022
Review: An intense battle between security and law - may truth prevail!
Review_Url: You would imagine that security forces and law are the two sides of the same coin and must always work hand in hand. Not true! Jai Bhim is the narrative of a real life incident and some real people where a fearless lawyer fights for the basic human rights of the underprivileged against the police force, dealing fire with fire in a backdrop of adversity.

The worst part is it will take years to (nearly) eradicate these issues. These problems are reducing, but not stopped.

Author: 8 November 2021
Review_Url: This film is based on true events that took place in Cuddalore district in 1993. In the original story, Rajakannu, a member of the Andai Kurumbar tribe whose main occupation was making bamboo baskets and agricultural labour, was accused of stealing jewels from a house that employed him. Based on the complaint, Rajkannu was taken into police custody.

Author: 20 November 2021
Review: Jai Bhimüôèüèª, Jai Bhim is such a great movie that I didn't watch this type of any movie. All characters are like real in this movie specially Surya sir and Jaiprakash sir
Review_Url:
Jai Bhimüôèüèª,
Jai Bhim is such a great movie that I didn't watch this type of any movie. All characters are like real in this movie specially Surya sir and Jaiprakash sir has done excellent performance. I didn't feel any boringness in the movie and didn't blink even once while watching the Jai Bhim movie. In this movie Suriya/Justice Chandru said "Law is a very powerful weapon Lekin aap is Hathiyar se kise bachate Hain isse Jaruri aur Kuchh Nahi hota" it means me a lot and nextly again he said "Gandhi Nehru jaise bade Neta hai yahan, Ambedkar Dikhai Kyon Nahin dete" this line gave me goosebumps because I am very big fan of Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar. After watch this film every other movies has faded for me. After all I want to say thanks to the director of this movie DJ Gnanavel for making of this great movie. I want to give 10 star out of 10 for this movie. I request all directors to make more movie like this. Thanks. Jai Bhim.

Author: 20 November 2021
Review_Url: Had a feeling of watched a quality movie after some time in this covid Pandamic. Defenitely worth to watch a movie that never makes you feel borred hold you tight on the seat to enjoy every bits of it. Jai Bhim the tittle itself means Journey from darkness to light which derrives energy from both Marx and Ambedkar. I think like PARASITE, Oscar awarded film Jai Bhim also spreading in to everyone heart. Everything about this Movie has to be praised be it camera, back ground score, plot, Casting, charecters etc. Certainly you will get al Kind of emotions, Joy, anger and tears! Good message to Society for people from any country because it is happening every where in any place. Atleast some film it without restriction. All charecters are well performed natural especialy rasakkannu Manikandan and his wife senkeni Lijo jose Marvellous. Soorya of course, great actor and Producer and he himself acted become strong added value for this film to bring more credits : Why Not OSCAR award for jai Bhim every where around globe people talking commenting reviewing giving Credits fir this beautiful movie.. Jai Bheem flawlessly speaks about custodial voilence, Police cover up, Systemic curruption at a huge leva. Moreover this film portraying the role of left in the life of dwon troddens ! In Many of the Scenes. And also in back ground red flague appearing and in the struggles leaders of the communist Party are present. The real life hero justice Rtd Chandru said that its Karl Marx who taught him to reach Dr Ambedkar. Its very proud to say that jai Bhim is the best film which i have ever seen in my Life. Its a brave and ideal act o Soorya and jyothi ka taking such a revolutionary decision to make this historic film into reality . Congrds T J JNANAWEL/the writer and Director for this heart breaking real life experience shown as a Mind blowing celluloid wonderüíñüî• CRüíù

Author: 9 December 2021
Review_Url: The movie, though slow in its first half, does a great job at bringing out the misuse of power by the Indian police force and the unjust treatment meted out to the tribal and lower caste communities of India. Still treated as untouchables, Dalits face great oppression every day across India and with the scenes in the police room or the general harassment faced by the characters, the movie does a fairly good job at bringing out the daily agonies of these oppressed citizen. The script is what makes the movie class apart, with fairly decent acting. The editing and shot selection could do with more finesse but the ending is just worth every wait and will surely make you tear up.

Author: 7 November 2021
Review_Url: It's always nice to see a star like Suriya move away from a typical masala flick for Diwali and come up with a hard-hitting courtroom drama based on actual events. In the film, he is more of a tool that helps enact justice for the oppressed victims. There's no showy entry, songs that praise him to the skies, or stock heroines who exist only to admire him. Instead, the film focuses more on the tribal characters played by Manikandan and Lijomol (both excellent) and the series of unfortunate events that they go through.

Author: 20 November 2021
Review: Jai Bhim definitely sowed seeds of equality again
Review_Url: There was a famous dialogue in the Hollywood movie, Lincoln. "Congress must never declare equal those who God created unequal." But still after so much debate Lincoln's power brought the under privileged rights on par with other humans on that time. This movie is one such historic movie, where an angry young south Indian lawer stood by TRUTH and against the mighty Government power and Caste power to win the case for an innocent tribal women whose husband was killed by police brutality.

Author: 18 November 2021
Review: A movie which truly tells the story it wants to Convey
Review_Url: One of the rare movie which has completely focused on the story line and not got distracted from the core topic of the plight of tribal community even for a minute. The makers of the movie should be commended for taking this topic up and presenting in the best possible manner.

Author: 3 December 2021
Review: As a movie it is good, but its drawback is it's part of propaganda
Review_Url: I have no obligations about story, screenplay whatsoever. My only disappointment is when a movie is portrayed as based on true story, the makers should not hesitate to include real names of the characters. After rigorous research about the incidents shown in the movie, its clear that one community which is soft target for post colonial mindset people. This is part of propaganda. That diminishes the credibility of a wonderful movie.

Author: 2 May 2023
Review: Take from an American: its a mixed bag!
Review_Url: I am basically in absolute agreement, without equivocation, of its main message against the rampant and wretched authority given to the police in this part of India (that I can gleam in general, not knowing much about how all the Caste systems work and just how much sub-*inspectors have in terms of power), while at the same time I bristle at the presentation - how the same hand that beats these poor peasants in the jail cell is as heavy as the director who's wielding the camera and editing software. And I know I know I know I know, these movies are what they are, but for this to be even in some part a Musical kind of undermines to me the shock and real pain and agony of the citizens here. (Just imagine like, I dunno, Kiarostami making this).

Author: 3 February 2022
Review_Url: Gnanavel written and directed Jai Bhim is based on true story of brutal murder of a tribal man in police custody. The man is tortured along with two others to elicit confession of a theft they did not commit of jewelry of powerful village chief. The tribal dies in the process and his illiterate pregnant wife with the help of village teacher approaches a lawyer who works hard to bring the police department to justice.

Author: 18 January 2023
Review_Url: Really like Suriya and his acting, from Ghajini to recent Soorarai Pottru i enjoyed his movie. But this movie was made with unwanted controversies. Movie is based on real incident... fine, then show as it happened why you change the religion? The movie tried to portray discrimination experienced by the unprivileged class of society... It's a good thought. But in the real incident (based which this movie was made) the sub inspector was a Christian but in the movie his character was modified into an upper caste man. Why Anthony Das becomes Guru here? All other main character names are retained. The original characters have been intentionally replaced to target specific communities who are against the Surya's favorite Ruling party. Only because their minority appeasement will come to stake or there will be a question mark on their so called secularism ideology. The moment I saw Periyar (person who was believed to fight against discrimination, but filled with hatred towards hindu traditions) I was disgusted. This movie is made to create hate towards certain communities which was unnecessary.

Author: 8 November 2021
Review_Url:
9.7 given by IMDb and TOI and other bunch of scrap reviewer give 3.5 *That's discrimination in Reality.* Raw Performance, Strong character build up and Pure acting with Brutal Truth of our modern society. *That's what Jai Bhim is.* A Great movie and awesome direction. This is not just a movie it provide insight of how wonderful is our democracy with great judicial system. Every character pulled out very nicely by the director. Surya's role as Advocate Chandru is just awesome. Kudos to Lijomol Jose acting. Salute to all team and Director TJ Gnanavel to present such sensitive subject so well. Jai Bhim is by far the best movie on caste discrimination. It is raw and real. The actors have done a splendid job. The director has a firm grip on the narrative and never for a moment deviates from the subject. It is a treat to watch Surya perform in a meaningful and powerful role after a long time. *A must watch for those who love humanity and for those who stand for equality*
*Jay Bhim* üôèüèªüíôüíôüíô

Author: 18 November 2021
Review: TO, who gave 1 star and hate this movie
Review_Url: TO, who gave 1 star and hate this movie there is a dialoge in the move.soorarai pottru Neenga(you pepole are) socialite nanga (we are ) socilist. Neenga vara nanga vara. And i saw few comments saying that this movie has violence and communist ideologies. I think those didn't aware this movie inspired by the true incident that happened way back in 1993. A man named Rajakannu from the Irular tribe was falsely framed in a theft case. The horrific death of Rajakannu due to the custodial torture was a challenging and landmark legal battle for Justice K. Chandru is a former Madras High Court Judge appointed by President Dr. A. P. J. Abdul Kalam to the Madras High Court. When the victim's wife Sengani (real name Parvathi) came to the lawyer for help and the case trail was happened 15 years and he is not charging a single rupee for this case.

Author: 6 November 2021
Review: For the people, of the people, by the elite
Review_Url: Where I lived in Patna, a community called Mushahar lived around us. Shriek cries of pigs being hunted and skinned, their catch of field rats and squirrels that they displayed, their habitat and drunken squabbles bothered our middle-class sensibilities a lot. Even in those urban surroundings, we were all told to take care of our belongings from these nomadic urchins. 'Jai Bhim' took me back to those personal memories and showed me a mirror of ignorance and insensitivity towards these marginal communities.

Author: 12 November 2021
Review: A near-great commercial film about social injustice.
Review_Url: The moment I finished watching Jai Bhim I was left wondering whether Surya playing the lead is a boon or a bane. On one hand the presence of a big star like Surya would inevitably lead to certain "mass" scenes which might bother the emotional flow and on the other hand his presence would also bring in tons of audience to this film that is addressing an important issue. Jai Bhim is about a horrific real incident that happened in the 90's but the problem it's addressing is as relevant today as it was back then. The initial portions of the film where we see the life of Irulars are amazing. We get to know them, their lifestyle and, most importantly, how they're treated. Then the film segues into the real issue. I wish the film had been treated like Visaranai. This movie is just a bit too commercial for such a sensitive topic but i get it, a film like Visaranai would never reach as many people as this has. Anyways this is a very important film about casteism, social injustice and police brutality.

Review_Url: One of the exceptional, outstanding movies of Hot Chocolate, Hot Shot, Actor Suriya (Younger Killer Looks). Court drama that is so thoroughly astonishing & engaging right from the start of the movie. Distinctively unique, even from the very first 5-10 minutes. Definitely from the lines of "Visaranai", I am getting used to the recent cinematic legal works such as Nerkonda Paarvai, Ponmagal Vandhal etc, these kind of thought-provoking scripts is fast catching up as a trending inspiration for all film makers.

Author: 10 November 2021
Review: Most powerful medium, explored to its fullest! Well, it made me sign-up on imdb!!!
Review_Url: Film is probably the most powerful medium to date, to get someone you have never seen or known to see what you see as you see it. To realise the full potential of its power, you need a message that is strong and abiding, you need a life experience exploring the full breath of the message, you need impeccable technical proficiency that is unobtrusive, you need uncompromising artistic integrity that understands every silver pixel in every frame is as important as every other- that they paint the one picture over the whole span of the film, you need adherence to truth as expressed through the life of the characters, you need minimal script to render the communication language independent, you need understated music scores enabling you to pack time, you need background music to to string your scenes seamlessly, you need artistes who shine by their effortless restrain, enabling every other artiste bring-out their best, and you need a story that every one of your audience can resonate with either through their own direct experience or through indirect experience from others they know or headline news or history.

Review_Url: Just watched Jai Bhim pahhhhh what a movie after soorarai potru Suriya's another solid movie... personally I'll rank it as Suriya's No1 best movie... everyone should watch this film...the whole film is about how humans are separating people with caste and status...and how awfully upper caste people are treating lower caste...but also there are a lot of meaningful things in this film...lijomol is the woman of the match...her performance without a doubt deserves a national award, and Manikandan performance also very realistic and heartbreaking and of course the direction, cinematography,writing screenplay all superb....this film is an example on how Indian film industry should make a film..hatsoff to Surya and the team.hope this film earn at least a nomination in Oscars...the impact of this film is still living in me.

If any toxics is saying negative about acting and direction, don't see that points. I will assure that it is one of the best movie in the film industry.

Author: 22 November 2021
Review_Url: I do not watch many Tamil movies but always appreciated their making. Just by looking at the ratings, I started to watch the film. No trailer watch, nothing. At first 30 mins, it took me some time to understand the plot of the movie. Afterwards, the movie was an emotional rollercoaster. Very well made as well as extra ordinary story telling. The movie is not cheesy or fast like other Tamil movies. It gradually builds up a rational story. The only thing I felt bad after watching the movie is that the real woman (sengini) did not get the compensation which the movie depicts. Other than that, its a top notch movie.

Author: 27 January 2022
Review: It is just anothe of a kind!
Review_Url: From the trailer you can guess what is the storyline. You might also forecast the turn of events as well. Still, this movie has accomplished such a height which is hardly achieved on the silver screen so far. It can' t get more realistic, graphic, agonizing, thought provoking than this. It is both scenic and sinister at the same time. If you are a cheap wiper and light hearted person avoid watching this in front of others. This movie is something which is more realistic than a documentary. Nothing epic yet the most epic journey. Nothing dramatic yet drama at its best. No bold action move or super heroism yet portrays the heroic battle like a medieval knight's heroic tale. Do yourself a favor, have a watch. You will be mesmerized. True story or not this is as much true as it can get.

Author: 8 November 2021
Review: A good movie with plenty of noise pollution .
Review_Url: As with most good South movie , it is spoiled by too many unwanted noises created by the casts . I found it unbearably irritating the way the women in the movie , especially the wife of the victim cries in every scene unnecessarily. Tears are effective on screen when they are shown only when necessary , making it occur every second scene , combined with lots of wailing and bawling , just diminishes its effectiveness in garnering sympathy . If fact every time she started wailing I hoped the cop would shut her up . Maybe, it's only in the Hindi dubbed version that all these unnecessary loud noises are shown and not in its original format. But all the same a good movie was ruined by some very unwanted overacting by its female casts and a few male cast as well , like the short guy in the lock up as well as in the end at the court .what any guy in court would have given his statement in a normal and controlled manner , this fellow was overflowing with mile long tears and wailing with more unwanted noises .When he was doing his teary acts , I so wanted the cop or anyone in the movie to just kill him too , just to shut his bawling .It was that unbearable. Why couldn't the director make it more realistic and less melodramatic like rest of the movie ? Would have been well deserving the fantastic IMBD ratings had it not been for these stupid melodramas and sound pollutions . Having said that , the movie was an out an out entertaining movie and thoroughly captivating .

Review_Url:
I have seen 1000s of movies, series, etc
This is by far one of the *MOST* apt performances displaying a population of 17% lower caste individuals in the 2nd most populous country in the world; where slavery, rape/gang-rape, murder, prostitution, torture, etc ensues freely even after 75 years of India's independence and under different governments like Congress, BJP, etc
This country has been in constant turmoil for a very, VERY long time.

Instead, the film focuses more on the tribal characters played by Manikandan and Lijomol (both excellent) and the series of unfortunate events that they go through.

Author: 3 November 2021
Review_Url: Jai Bhim movie show cases how an advocate and human rights activist fought for justice for Tribals and Lower caste people who are arrested under false charges for a variety of petty crimes and are subjected to brutality by police and prejudiced judicial system. The story is set in 1993. But as I was watching this story, the tragic lockup deaths of Jayraj and Bennicks in 2020 came to my mind. Police brutality is a real thing. But the plight of tribals and dalits who can't afford high priced advocates to prove their innocence is swept under the rugs.

Review: Movie of the Millennium. So raw on social issues and abuses undergone by Common and ordinary fellow beings. Must watch!Anything below 10, pretty sure nothing can merry them!
Review_Url: Absolutely spine-chilling story and outstanding cast, emotions, screenplay, direction, bgm. Its a must watch and an epitome of how movies should be made these days, rather than superhero stunts and romantic fantasies, guiding younger generation to ignorance. It would really be true that the actors have lived the characters in the movie and Sengani cast has been played outstandingly by Lijo Mol Jose, Rajkannu by Manikandan. Surya and director has done an absolutely amazing job in making this movie and bring awareness to the so-called freedom and equality. Upcoming movies should come up with society's burning issues like this and bring awareness to the younger generation. I am not sure why anyone would rate below 10, if they happen to do it, I am pretty sure something is wrong with the way they have been brought up. Either they are in the upper supporting caste or some mentally retarded that enjoys sufferings of fellow human beings.

Review_Url: This movie is just awesome. Everything about it is top notch. It shows the real face of society where humanity is dead due to discrimination. The story was set up in early-mid 90s. Take a bow entire team!

Review_Url: Perfect. One of the exceptional, outstanding movies of Hot Chocolate, Hot Shot, Actor Suriya (Younger Killer Looks). Court drama that is so thoroughly astonishing & engaging right from the start of the movie. Distinctively unique, even from the very first 5-10 minutes. Definitely from the lines of "Visaranai", I am getting used to the recent cinematic legal works such as Nerkonda Paarvai, Ponmagal Vandhal etc, these kind of thought-provoking scripts is fast catching up as a trending inspiration for all film makers.

Author: 20 November 2021
Review_Url: Had a feeling of watched a quality movie after some time in this covid Pandamic. Defenitely worth to watch a movie that never makes you feel borred hold you tight on the seat to enjoy every bits of it. Jai Bhim the tittle itself means Journey from darkness to light which derrives energy from both Marx and Ambedkar. I think like PARASITE, Oscar awarded film Jai Bhim also spreading in to everyone heart. Everything about this Movie has to be praised be it camera, back ground score, plot, Casting, charecters etc. Certainly you will get al Kind of emotions, Joy, anger and tears! Good message to Society for people from any country because it is happening every where in any place. Atleast some film it without restriction. All charecters are well performed natural especialy rasakkannu Manikandan and his wife senkeni Lijo jose Marvellous. Soorya of course, great actor and Producer and he himself acted become strong added value for this film to bring more credits : Why Not OSCAR award for jai Bhim every where around globe people talking commenting reviewing giving Credits fir this beautiful movie.. Jai Bheem flawlessly speaks about custodial voilence, Police cover up, Systemic curruption at a huge leva. Moreover this film portraying the role of left in the life of dwon troddens ! In Many of the Scenes. And also in back ground red flague appearing and in the struggles leaders of the communist Party are present. The real life hero justice Rtd Chandru said that its Karl Marx who taught him to reach Dr Ambedkar. Its very proud to say that jai Bhim is the best film which i have ever seen in my Life. Its a brave and ideal act o Soorya and jyothi ka taking such a revolutionary decision to make this historic film into reality . Congrds T J JNANAWEL/the writer and Director for this heart breaking real life experience shown as a Mind blowing celluloid wonderüíñüî• CRüíù

Author: 20 November 2021
Review_Url: The film is publicized that the movie is based on real facts. However there are many factual errors in the film. For example, the villain is named in the film as Guru, where the actual person's name is Anthonysamy and victim woman is named as Sengeni in the film, where her real name is Parvathi. Film depicts that the victims belong to Irular community where the actual victims (in real) belong to Kuravar community.

Author: 16 November 2021
Review: Exceptional acting and undistorted reality more than compensate for the minor flaws
Review_Url: The actors simply lived their characters and the movie was brutal and unapologetically real about this system of a down that constantly hunts, denies rights and tortures the tribes of this land! Every dark facet of the system is clearly visible and exposed in this movie, in a very matter of fact way! A tight slap by the policeman to the criminal that blabbers arrogantly in Hindi when asked questions in Tamil (although he's well versed in Tamil), despite being the cunning creature engaging in everything illegal was absolutely befitting and not too fantastic to be real! To mainain such momentum despite such a serious and subject is indeed commendable! In my opinion, a movie that really connects with me manages to tear me up a couple of times and this movie gave me at least ten instances with such impactful dialogues and I must say that this is the best Tamil movie I've ever watched!

Review_Url:
Jai Bheem Namo Buddhay....üôèüôèüôèüôè
This movie is excellent üëç and real hero DR. AMBEDKAR JIII...
Bhimrao Ramji Ambedkar 14 April 1891 - 6 December 1956) was an Indian jurist, economist, and social reformer who fought economic and social discrimination against the untouchables (now dalits) in India's Hindu society, and who later renounced Hinduism and inspired the Dalit Buddhist movement. Ambedkar served as chairman of the drafting committee of the Constitution of India, and Minister of Law and Justice in the first cabinet of Jawaharlal Nehru from 1947 to 1951. He is also referred to by the honorific Babasaheb.

Author: 4 November 2021
Review_Url: In a scene in Jai Bhim, a group of tribals man meet a police office who is heading an inquiry commission about the disappearance of three missing tribals who were being interrogated by the police about a theft case. One man tells him that he was once arrested by cops just for greeting them. Another tells him about how he was arrested just because he tried to slink away fearing them. A woman narrates how her husband was forced to 'confess' to a crime which he had not committed after the cops started molesting her. A young boy mentions that the police picked him up just because they could not get his father, and how that one incident made him a perennial suspect at school. These people are clearly damned if they did, and damned if they didn't.

Author: 3 November 2021
Review: Best movie on casteism and police brutality
Review_Url: I have no words to describe how great this movie is. Though this movie is in telugu but police brutality and casteism remains same no matter in which state that brutality took place. We live in so called 21st century but nothing has changed neither the police brutality nor the casteism. The upper caste still enjoys privileges of being part of that caste and lower caste / tribals bears the harassment from upper caste plus the society. The movie is an eye opener on the casteism that still exists in our fake modern society. This country still need honest lawyers who believes in standing up for those who are denied justice and standing against who misuses the power and law. About the slapping scene where police officer slapped the person to speak in tamil I couldn't find anything offensive. Everyone is proud of their mother language and one should remember hindi is not a national language so dont impose it on everyone. Don't ruin the rational behind the movie over just one scene. The movie shows us the horrible state of this society upper caste lower caste and of course the police brutality no doubt why I still hate police so much.

Author: 2 November 2021
Review: This is a True story that happened 26 years before. Please watch the movie and know how old generation treated people who they think as low grade
Review_Url: The screenplay the script has scenes that are required and necessary. The way it was projected to showcase the true story that happened 26 years before is pretty awesome. Everybody's acting is treat to your eyes. Sengeni character in the movie brings tears every time she appears in search of the truth behind her husband missing. Chandru as a lawyer does anything and everything legally to bring justice to Sengeni. His expressions speak. Climax scene emotions and expressions by Chandru character is awesome and makes you feel the same way he feels. Characters represented as higher grade people treat Rasakannu and Sengeni and their people very bad as if they are untouchables and low grade people. Even when they know these people are good, they won't help them or save them from Police. Lawyers who support villains have done the given job and executed it well. We get angry on why such lawyers even exist helping wrong people and encouraging them to do more. Treat every man and woman from any caste equally. Have heart and treat everybody with humanity. If people we start respecting everybody and treating others with humanity and helping needy people by means of education and employment, each and every family will definitely raise their status from Poverty to at least middle class eventually someday. I request everybody who reads my review to help somebody in need by any means you can help.

Author: 2 November 2021
Review: JAI BHIM JAI BHIM JAI BHIM Gem Of indian cinema.
Review_Url: The best movie in the history of indian cinema inspired by none other than The Great Babasaheb Dr. BR. Ambedkar. This movie highlights the relavance and importance Of values of Babasaheb Dr. BR. Ambedkar. Surya as advocate chandru outperformed his previous characters. Lijomol jose is pillar of the movie. She deserves the most highest honorary award of the country. Prakash Raj as usually lived in the character. He is unmatchable. Manikandan is the best. The movie highlights the plight of Tribals, the atrocities committed on them by police and state. These are the type of movies that are needed for our country. Kudos to Tamil industry. Gnanavel deserves huge applause for his direction and sean Roldan gave excellent BGM. Dont miss the titles at the end of the movie that gives the insight of life of Justice chandru Sir. Please watch hindi movie Halla Ho. JAI BHIM JAI BHIM JAI BHIM.

Review_Url: Great Movie.... Tribal life and their rights are cleverly delivered...at some point i forgot that i am watching movie and seeing their pain in real. The cast and locations are so real...The court room drama and the flashbacks are well balanced and at end credits makes the awe... Kudos to Jo and Surya for producing this movie... At any point this movie could become a documentary, but director brilliantly maintained the mainstream movie entertainment throughout the story telling.... Another big advantage is that you will never feel the preaching/advising tone and it is not biased.

Author: 5 December 2021
Review_Url: It's always nice to see a star like Suriya move away from a typical masala flick for Diwali and come up with a hard-hitting courtroom drama based on actual events. In the film, he is more of a tool that helps enact justice for the oppressed victims. There's no showy entry, songs that praise him to the skies, or stock heroines who exist only to admire him. Instead, the film focuses more on the tribal characters played by Manikandan and Lijomol (both excellent) and the series of unfortunate events that they go through.

I always thinks that when will I see a movie which can open the eyes of the people and reveal how much pain,atrocities, tortures had encountered a lower caste community and still it is running. Review: A movie that has lasting emotion days after watching

Author: 9 December 2021
Review_Url: A story that truly covers the real life experience of the lesser privileged in India. After reading the book this movie was based on I feel that they have tried their best not to dramatize many aspects of what had happened. Usually with court room dramas you have these over the top monologues . And any one with experiences in a court room know that it is never such a case. Very beautifully done. And that too done in a way that doesn't scream or shout excesses. A must watch story of those who don't have any voice.

Author: 21 January 2022
Review: Hard Hitting flim of decade... Suriya üî•üî•
Review_Url: Hard hitting flim of decade. Had a feeling of watched a quality movie after some time in this covid Pandamic. Defenitely worth to watch a movie that never makes you feel borred hold you tight on the seat to enjoy every bits of it. Jai Bhim the tittle itself means Journey from darkness to light which derrives energy from both Marx and Ambedkar. I think like PARASITE, Oscar awarded film Jai Bhim also spreading in to everyone heart. Everything about this Movie has to be praised be it camera, back ground score, plot, Casting, charecters etc. Certainly you will get al Kind of emotions, Joy, anger and tears! Good message to Society for people from any country because it is happening every where in any place. Atleast some film it without restriction. All charecters are well performed natural especialy rasakkannu Manikandan and his wife senkeni Lijo jose Marvellous. Soorya of course, great actor and Producer and he himself acted become strong added value for this film to bring more credits : Why Not OSCAR award for jai Bhim every where around globe people talking commenting reviewing giving Credits fir this beautiful movie.. Jai Bheem flawlessly speaks about custodial voilence, Police cover up, Systemic curruption at a huge.

Author: 3 November 2021
Review_Url: Jai bhim showcast caste discrimination of tribal people,and police brutality and injustice in modern India in the nutshell. Police exploit the tribal people to close out case by frame them and torture them to acknowledge the crime that they never commit. The movie presents two big issues to the state and union governments, that are equlity caused by caste practices and Police Brutality. Police reforms to end the torture and fake cases and body cams and CCTV cameras on every police station. Equality or social justice to give the tribal people a chance to live a peaceful life such as land to live, educational opportunities, care for necessities, change to thought process of caste based inequality.

Author: 12 November 2021
Review: Why only Negative character's name changed from true event??
Review_Url: Film Jai Bheem is based on a true incident. In 1993, a tribal man named Rajakannu, falsely framed in a theft case, was brutally tortured and kiIIed by cops lead by Sub Inspector Anthony Samy. Rajakannu's wife approaches advocate Chandru who fights the case and gets justice for Rajakannu.

Author: 17 November 2021
Review_Url: While I cannot deny the fact that the movie has been treated in a little unrealistic manner the way mainstream movies does to heighten the impact of the story. Some may cringe, some may whistle. I did wish that it was treated in a matter of fact way, but, I am extremely satisfied thinking that it reaches a larger audience with the kind of treatment it has been given and with the start power of Suriya. Now, when I say star power, I would highly appreciate if many of our stars used their power to bring in stories like this that would actually contribute to the awareness and therefore, progress of the society instead of indulging in no-brainer movies all the time. Of course, one can enjoy it, but when you have such a huge influence on people, why not use it for good? Coming to the movie, despite the minor issue, by and large, I extremely loved it. One can't deny that it makes you think and introspect. The title of movie sounded gimmicky to me initially but by the time the end credits started rolling, I found myself guilty for thinking so. The subtle tribute it gives to the father of the Indian constitution is very well deserved. Of course, such success stories are far and wide from one to the other, but it gives us hope that judiciary wasn't given that extra independence for nothing. For the marginalized section of the society, where even the Government treats them like outsiders in many cases, they have got no one but the judiciary to look up to for protection. It's sad that such cases are very rare. India, by large, hasn't been able to achieve the kind of progress despite all the infrastructural, technological and what not progress that we have achieved over the years, simply because the very foundation of our society is still based on malice, discrimination, prejudice. Where one would openly protest against reservation but would hesitate to speak up for the rights of minorities, it is a clear indication of the fact that we still haven't come out from the clutches of the evils that plagued our society centuries ago. I personally believe that, before the government or judiciary or for that matter, even the constitution, it is extremely important for each and every individual to bring progress within their mindset and conscience. That, in itself would be the start to a progressive environment. This is something I seriously want people to discuss and consider it important. There are many movies based on similar subject, but I recommend you all to watch this wonderful movie. It will definitely make you think.

Author: 28 August 2022
Review: Don't even think twice, just watch it!
Review_Url: Movie begins with the story of tribals from a backward village. It depicts the real challenges faced by the tribals to make their ends meet. The main focus of the movie is on false theft case against Rajakunnu(brilliantly played) and his two friends. Later in the first half, it is marked by the heroic entry of Adv Chandru who fights for the justice and truth. He has played his role superbly, even you can feel his rhetoric in the movie. I really enjoyed some of his punch lines "We can see Gandhi and Nehru but we can't find Bhim". Sengeni, who was wife of Rajakunnu has also played her role brilliantly. At the end of the movie, Sengeni tries to give her Mangal Sutra to Adv Chandra as the fees of her case but he refuses to take it by asking her what if someone would have come to you with agony of snake's bite. Would you not save their life if they were not able to pay you the money. I am really sorry at this point as I have missed a point, this tribe was expert at saving people's life from the snake's bite. This scene is heart melting and you can feel it. Now why am I deducting two stars, the reason is torture performed by the police will give you goosebumps. But in my opinion this has been exaggerated to seek more attention from the audience. But overall, we can say this movie is worth watching.

Author: 30 April 2022
Review_Url: This film was one of the finest movies I have ever seen. Great choices of props, style, and clothing to match the cultural context. Lighting was great to match the situations as well as camera angling. For example, low key lighting to match the intense or violent sequences. Dialogue was perfect as there weren't really any cliches of any sort and they hit hard as well. The sound direction was phenomenal. Performances were outstanding. This movie had a good theme as well and how they portray that on screen with their technical aspects was great for making the audience to sympathize with the characters. Whether people agree with the message or not, the movie did an amazing job of calling attention to the marginalized communities and promoting change. It also emphasized the importance of finding truth and restoring faith in the justice system when it fails the people. Those are some of the most important things that we have to open our minds for to this day. Now while the movie isn't 100% accurate accordingly to the true events, we have to remember that is a story constructed based off true events. Its message is basically to let us know that these kinds of atrocities are happening and that we should try to prevent it from happening again. We should focus on the message that they portray through onscreen elements and judge the movie accordingly to that. Overall, great work by the crew!

Author: 7 November 2021
Review_Url: I have watched this movie. Fistly i like to add that Jai Bhim is based on a true incident that happened in the 90s. The film talks about the police brutality and caste injustice meted out to the members of the Irular tribe. What a movie man i will surely suggest everyone to watch the movie its so important to know what this people was or is going through.

Author: 19 November 2021
Review_Url: Most of the south indian movie i watch for entertainment but when it comes to this movie Jay Bhim its different. It is recommended by some random ppl and watched it with family. Its not the movie of entertainment only but also lot of factor like the reality of dalit society which they hv to face even in current situation.

Review_Url: Wowwwwwww !!!! Whatta a movie. This is my first time giving like to any movie and it's 10/10. This movie just touched my heart. I recommend this movie to everyone. Please love one another no matter what.

Author: 26 November 2021
Review: Sprinkled Venom in an excellent movie
Review_Url: Justice is needed for writer Kanmani Gunasekaran. His story was terribly misused in this movie. His community and his name was terribly misused by TJ Gnannavel in this movie. Portraying a Community as Evil where that community fought for the rights of the affected community in the real history. Please don't sprinkle Venom against some in an excellent Artwork like mentioning the identity of political party as enemitic in the screen many times.
